title: Drawing, Design for Serving Table with Two Shelves and Ball and Claw Feet, 1900–05
title_raw: Design for Serving Table with Two Shelves and Ball and Claw Feet
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper left of design: V+[box with dot in center]X / 80., and along left edge, upper right, and upper left quadrant of image, numerical notations indicating dimensions
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Rectangular table top with 2 drawers at front, raised on 4 straight tapering bracket-shaped legs terminating in scrolling ball and claw feet with acanthus leaf motifs at fronts; 2 conforming lower shelves (the middle one suggested faintly in graphite) attached below table top; backsplash.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Serving Table with Two Shelves and Ball and Claw Feet, 1900–05. Graphite on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-70
